018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.System.arraycopy;
021import static java.lang.System.getProperties;
022import static java.lang.System.getenv;
023import static java.util.regex.Pattern.compile;
024import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
025import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.determineIPAddress;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.getMACAddress;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.getNodeId;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.getPID;
034
035import java.io.Serial;
036import java.io.Serializable;
037import java.net.SocketException;
038import java.time.Instant;
039import java.util.Collection;
040import java.util.HashMap;
041import java.util.HashSet;
042import java.util.Map;
043import java.util.Optional;
044import java.util.Set;
045import java.util.function.Function;
046import java.util.regex.Pattern;
047import java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException;
048
049import org.apiguardian.api.API;
050import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
051import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.MountPoint;
052import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ImpossibleExceptionError;
053
054/**
055 *  <p>{@summary An instance of this class is basically a wrapper around a
056 *  String that contains placeholders (&quot;Variables&quot;) in the form
057 *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>, where &lt;<i>name</i> is the variable
058 *  name.}</p>
059 *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
060 *  <p>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the letters
061 *  from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from '0' to '9' and
062 *  the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'), after an optional
063 *  prefix character.</p>
064 *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal sign
065 *  ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
066 *  ('&amp;').</p>
067 *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
068 *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a special
069 *  variable.</p>
070 *  <p>When the system data is added as source (see
071 *  {@link #replaceVariableFromSystemData(CharSequence, Map[]) replaceVariableFromSystemData()}
072 *  and
073 *  {@link #replaceVariable(boolean, Map[]) replaceVariable()}
074 *  with {@code addSystemData} set to {@code true}), some additional variables
075 *  are available:</p>
076 *  <dl>
077 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_IPAddress}</dt>
078 *      <dd>One of the outbound IP addresses of the machine that executes the
079 *      current program, if network is configured at all.</dd>
080 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_MACAddress}</dt>
081 *      <dd>The MAC address of the machine that executes the current program;
082 *      if no network is configured, a dummy address is used.</dd>
083 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_NodeId}</dt>
084 *      <dd>The node id of the machines that executes the current program; if
085 *      no network is configured, a pseudo node id is used.</dd>
086 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_Now}</dt>
087 *      <dd>The current data and time in UTC time zone.</dd>
088 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_pid}</dt>
089 *      <dd>The process id of the current program.</dd>
090 *  </dl>
091 *
092 *  @see #VARNAME_IPAddress
093 *  @see #VARNAME_MACAddress
094 *  @see #VARNAME_NodeId
095 *  @see #VARNAME_Now
096 *  @see #VARNAME_pid
097 *
098 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
099 *  @version $Id: Template.java 966 2022-01-04 22:28:49Z tquadrat $
100 *
101 *  @UMLGraph.link
102 *  @since 0.1.0
103 */
104@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Template.java 966 2022-01-04 22:28:49Z tquadrat $" )
105@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
106public class Template implements Serializable
107{
108        /*-----------*\
109    ====** Constants **========================================================
110        \*-----------*/
111    /**
112     *  The variable name for the IP address of the executing machine:
113     *  {@value}.
114     *
115     *  @since 0.1.0
116     */
117    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
118    public static final String VARNAME_IPAddress = "org.tquadrat.ipaddress";
119
120    /**
121     *  The variable name for the MAC address of the executing machine:
122     *  {@value}.
123     *
124     *  @since 0.1.0
125     */
126    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
127    public static final String VARNAME_MACAddress = "org.tquadrat.macaddress";
128
129    /**
130     *  The variable name for the node id of the executing machine: {@value}.
131     *
132     *  @since 0.1.0
133     */
134    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
135    public static final String VARNAME_NodeId = "org.tquadrat.nodeid";
136
137    /**
138     *  The variable name for the current date and time: {@value}.
139     *
140     * @see Instant#now()
141     *
142     *  @since 0.1.0
143     */
144    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
145    public static final String VARNAME_Now = "org.tquadrat.now";
146
147    /**
148     *  The variable name for the id of the current process, executing this
149     *  program: {@value}.
150     *
151     *  @since 0.1.0
152     */
153    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
154    public static final String VARNAME_pid = "org.tquadrat.pid";
155
156    /**
157     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
158     *  {@value}.
159     *
160     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
161     *  @see #findVariables()
162     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
163     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
164     *  @see #replaceVariable(Map...)
165     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
166     *  @see #replaceVariable(Function)
167     *
168     *  @since 0.1.0
169     */
170    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
171    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
172    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = "\\$\\{((?:_)|(?:[~/=%:&]?\\p{IsAlphabetic}(?:\\p{IsAlphabetic}|\\p{Digit}|_|.)*?))}";
173
174    /**
175     *  The template for variables: {@value}. The argument is the name of the
176     *  variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may not contain
177     *  other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower
178     *  case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore
179     *  ('_') and dot ('.').<br>
180     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
181     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
182     *  ('&amp;').<br>
183     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
184     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
185     *  special variable.
186     *
187     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
188     *
189     *  @since 0.1.0
190     */
191    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
192    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = "${%1$s}";
193
194        /*------------*\
195    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
196        \*------------*/
197    /**
198     *  The template text.
199     */
200    private final String m_TemplateText;
201
202        /*------------------------*\
203    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
204        \*------------------------*/
205    /**
206     *  The pattern that is used to identify a variable in a char sequence.
207     *
208     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
209     *  @see #replaceVariable(Map...)
210     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
211     *  @see #findVariables()
212     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
213     */
214    private static final Pattern m_VariablePattern;
215
216    /**
217     *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
218     *
219     *  @hidden
220     */
221    @Serial
222    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
223
224    static
225    {
226        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
227        try
228        {
229            m_VariablePattern = compile( VARIABLE_PATTERN );
230        }
231        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
232        {
233            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
234        }
235    }
236
237        /*--------------*\
238    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
239        \*--------------*/
240    /**
241     *  Creates a new instance of {@code Template}.
242     *
243     *  @param  templateText    The template text, containing variable in the
244     *      form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>.
245     */
246    public Template( final CharSequence templateText )
247    {
248        m_TemplateText = requireNonNullArgument( templateText, "templateText" ).toString();
249    }   //  Template()
250
251        /*---------*\
252    ====** Methods **==========================================================
253        \*---------*/
254    /**
255     *  The mount point for template manipulations in derived classes.<br>
256     *  <br>The default implementation will just return the argument.
257     *
258     *  @param  templateText    The template text, as it was given to the
259     *      constructor on creation of the object instance.
260     *  @return The adjusted template text.
261     */
262    @SuppressWarnings( "static-method" )
263    @MountPoint
264    protected String adjustTemplate( final String templateText )
265    {
266        return templateText;
267    }   //  adjustTemplate()
268
269    /**
270     *  Builds the source map with the additional data.
271     *
272     *  @return The source map.
273     *
274     *  @see #VARNAME_IPAddress
275     *  @see #VARNAME_MACAddress
276     *  @see #VARNAME_NodeId
277     *  @see #VARNAME_Now
278     *  @see #VARNAME_pid
279     */
280    private static final Map<String,Object> createAdditionalSource()
281    {
282        final Map<String,Object> retValue = new HashMap<>(
283            Map.of( VARNAME_MACAddress, getMACAddress(), VARNAME_pid, Long.valueOf( getPID() ), VARNAME_NodeId, Long.valueOf( getNodeId() ), VARNAME_Now, Instant.now() )
284        );
285        try
286        {
287            determineIPAddress().ifPresent( i -> retValue.put( VARNAME_IPAddress, i ) );
288        }
289        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final SocketException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
290
291        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
292        return retValue;
293    }   //  createAdditionalSource()
294
295    /**
296     *  Escapes backslash ('\') and dollar sign ('$') for regex replacements.
297     *
298     *  @param  s   The source string.
299     *  @return The string with the escaped characters.
300     *
301     *  @see java.util.regex.Matcher#appendReplacement(StringBuffer,String)
302     *
303     *  @since 0.1.0
304     */
305    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
306    private static String escapeRegexReplacement( final CharSequence s )
307    {
308        assert nonNull( s ) : "s is null";
309
310        //---* Escape the backslashes and dollar signs *-------------------
311        final var len = s.length();
312        final var retValue = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
313        char c;
314        EscapeLoop: for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
315        {
316            c = s.charAt( i );
317            switch( c )
318            {
319                case '\\':
320                case '$':
321                    retValue.append( '\\' ); // The fall through is intended here!
322                    //$FALL-THROUGH$
323                default: // Do nothing ...
324            }
325            retValue.append( c );
326        }   //  EscapeLoop:
327
328        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
329        return retValue.toString();
330    }   //  escapeRegexReplacement()
331
332    /**
333     *  Collects all the variables of the form
334     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.<br>
335     *  <br>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
336     *  {@link Set}
337     *  will be returned.<br>
338     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
339     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
340     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
341     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
342     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
343     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
344     *  ('&amp;').<br>
345     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
346     *  special variable.
347     *
348     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
349     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
350     *
351     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
352     *
353     *  @since 0.0.5
354     */
355    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
356    public static final Set<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
357    {
358        final Collection<String> buffer = new HashSet<>();
359        if( nonNull( text ) )
360        {
361            final var matcher = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text );
362            String found;
363            while( matcher.find() )
364            {
365                found = matcher.group( 1 );
366                buffer.add( found );
367            }
368        }
369        final var retValue = Set.copyOf( buffer );
370
371        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
372        return retValue;
373    }   //  findVariables()
374
375    /**
376     *  Collects all the variables of the form
377     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the adjusted template.<br>
378     *  <br>If there are not any variables in there, an empty
379     *  {@link Collection}
380     *  will be returned.<br>
381     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
382     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
383     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
384     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
385     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
386     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
387     *  ('&amp;').<br>
388     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
389     *  special variable.
390     *
391     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
392     *
393     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
394     */
395    public final Set<String> findVariables()
396    {
397        final var retValue = findVariables( getTemplateText() );
398
399        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
400        return retValue;
401    }   //  findVariables()
402
403    /**
404     *  Mountpoint for the formatting of the result after the variables have
405     *  been replaced.<br>
406     *  <br>The default implementation just returns the result.
407     *
408     *  @param  text    The result from replacing the variables in the template
409     *      text.
410     *  @return The reformatted result.
411     */
412    @SuppressWarnings( "static-method" )
413    @MountPoint
414    protected String formatResult( final String text )
415    {
416        return text;
417    }   //  formatResult()
418
419    /**
420     *  Returns the template text after it has been processed by
421     *  {@link #adjustTemplate(String)}.
422     *
423     *  @return The adjusted template text.
424     */
425    protected final String getTemplateText() { return adjustTemplate( m_TemplateText ); }
426
427    /**
428     *  Checks whether the adjusted template contains the variable of
429     *  the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern
430     *  given in
431     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN})
432     *  with the given name.
433     *
434     *  @param  name    The name of the variable to look for.
435     *  @return {@code true} if the template contains the variable,
436     *      {@code false} otherwise.
437     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given argument is not valid as
438     *      a variable name.
439     *
440     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
441     */
442    public final boolean hasVariable( final String name )
443    {
444        if( !isValidVariableName( name ) ) throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "%s is not a valid variable name", name ) );
445
446        final var retValue = findVariables().contains( name );
447
448        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
449        return retValue;
450    }   //  hasVariable()
451
452    /**
453     *  Checks whether the given String contains at least one variable of the
454     *  form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern given in
455     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}).
456     *
457     *  @param  s   The String to test; can be {@code null}.
458     *  @return {@code true} if the String contains at least one variable,
459     *      {@code false} otherwise.
460     *
461     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
462     *
463     *  @since 0.1.0
464     */
465    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
466    public static final boolean hasVariables( final CharSequence s )
467    {
468        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( s ) && m_VariablePattern.matcher( s ).find();
469
470        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
471        return retValue;
472    }   //  hasVariables()
473
474    /**
475     *  Checks whether the adjusted template contains at least one variable of
476     *  the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern
477     *  given in
478     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}).
479     *
480     *  @return {@code true} if the template contains at least one variable,
481     *      {@code false} otherwise.
482     *
483     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
484     */
485    public final boolean hasVariables() { return hasVariables( getTemplateText() ); }
486
487    /**
488     *  Test whether the given String is a valid variable name.
489     *
490     *  @param  name    The bare variable name, without the surrounding
491     *      &quot;${&hellip;}&quot;.
492     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid for a variable name,
493     *      {@code false} otherwise.
494     *
495     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
496     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
497     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
498     *
499     *  @since 0.1.0
500     */
501    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
502    public static final boolean isValidVariableName( final CharSequence name )
503    {
504        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" ) );
505        if( retValue )
506        {
507            final var text = format( VARIABLE_TEMPLATE, name );
508            retValue = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text ).matches();
509        }
510
511        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
512        return retValue;
513    }   //  isValidVariableName()
514
515    /**
516     *  Checks whether the given String is a variable in the form
517     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code>, according to the pattern provided
518     *  in
519     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}.
520     *
521     *  @param  s   The String to test; can be {@code null}.
522     *  @return {@code true} if the given String is not {@code null}, not the
523     *      empty String, and it matches the given pattern, {@code false}
524     *      otherwise.
525     *
526     *  @since 0.1.0
527     */
528    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
529    public static final boolean isVariable( final CharSequence s )
530    {
531        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( s ) && m_VariablePattern.matcher( s ).matches();
532
533        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
534        return retValue;
535    }   //  isVariable()
536
537    /**
538     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
539     *  in the given String with values from the given maps. The method will
540     *  try the maps in the given sequence.<br>
541     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
542     *  replaced at all.<br>
543     *  <br>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
544     *  will not be replaced.<br>
545     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
546     *  <br>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
547     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
548     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
549     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
550     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
551     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
552     *  ('&amp;').<br>
553     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
554     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
555     *  special variable.
556     *
557     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
558     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
559     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
560     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
561     *
562     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
563     *
564     *  @since 0.1.0
565     */
566    @SafeVarargs
567    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
568    public static final String replaceVariable( final CharSequence text, final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
569    {
570        requireNonNullArgument( sources, "sources" );
571
572        final var retValue = replaceVariable( text, variable -> retrieveVariableValue( variable, sources ) );
573
574        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
575        return retValue;
576    }   //  replaceVariable()
577
578    /**
579     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
580     *  in the adjusted template with values from the given maps and returns it
581     *  after formatting the result. The method will try the maps in the given
582     *  sequence.<br>
583     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
584     *  replaced at all.<br>
585     *  <br>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
586     *  will not be replaced.<br>
587     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
588     *  <br>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
589     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
590     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
591     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
592     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
593     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
594     *  ('&amp;').<br>
595     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
596     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
597     *  special variable.
598     *
599     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
600     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
601     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
602     *
603     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
604     */
605    @SafeVarargs
606    public final String replaceVariable( final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
607    {
608        return replaceVariable( false, sources );
609    }   //  replaceVariable()
610
611    /**
612     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
613     *  in the adjusted template with values from the given maps and returns it
614     *  after formatting the result. The method will try the maps in the given
615     *  sequence.<br>
616     *  <br>If {@code addSystemData} is provided as {@code true}, the
617     *  {@linkplain System#getProperties() system properties}
618     *  and
619     *  {@linkplain System#getenv()} system environment}
620     *  will be searched for replacement values before any other source.<br>
621     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
622     *  replaced at all.<br>
623     *  <br>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
624     *  will not be replaced.<br>
625     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
626     *  <br>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
627     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
628     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
629     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
630     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
631     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
632     *  ('&amp;').<br>
633     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
634     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
635     *  special variable.
636     *
637     *  @param  addSystemData   {@code true} if the system properties and the
638     *      system environment should be searched for replacement values, too,
639     *      otherwise {@code false}.
640     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
641     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
642     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
643     *
644     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
645     *  @see #replaceVariableFromSystemData(CharSequence, Map[])
646     */
647    @SafeVarargs
648    public final String replaceVariable( final boolean addSystemData, final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
649    {
650        final var rawTemplate = getTemplateText();
651        final var processedText = addSystemData
652            ? replaceVariableFromSystemData( rawTemplate, sources )
653            : replaceVariable( rawTemplate, sources );
654        final var retValue = formatResult( processedText );
655
656        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
657        return retValue;
658    }   //  replaceVariable()
659
660    /**
661     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
662     *  in the adjusted template with values returned by the given retriever
663     *  function for the variable name, and returns it after formatting the
664     *  result.<br>
665     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
666     *  replaced at all.<br>
667     *  <br>If the retriever function returns a value that contains a variable
668     *  itself, this will not be replaced.<br>
669     *  <br>The retriever function will be called only once for each variable
670     *  name; if the text contains the same variable multiple times, it will
671     *  always be replaced with the same value.<br>
672     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
673     *  <br>Valid variable name may not contain other characters than the
674     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
675     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
676     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
677     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
678     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
679     *  ('&amp;').<br>
680     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
681     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
682     *  special variable.
683     *
684     *  @param  retriever   The function that will retrieve the replacement
685     *      values for the given variable names.
686     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
687     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
688     *
689     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
690     */
691    public final String replaceVariable( final Function<? super String, Optional<String>> retriever )
692    {
693
694        final var retValue = formatResult( replaceVariable( getTemplateText(), retriever ) );
695
696        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
697        return retValue;
698    }   //  replaceVariable()
699
700    /**
701     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
702     *  in the given String with values returned by the given retriever
703     *  function for the variable name.<br>
704     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
705     *  replaced at all.<br>
706     *  <br>If the retriever function returns a value that contains a variable
707     *  itself, this will not be replaced.<br>
708     *  <br>The retriever function will be called only once for each variable
709     *  name; if the text contains the same variable multiple times, it will
710     *  always be replaced with the same value.<br>
711     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
712     *  <br>Valid variable name may not contain other characters than the
713     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
714     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
715     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
716     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
717     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
718     *  ('&amp;').<br>
719     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
720     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
721     *  special variable.
722     *
723     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
724     *  @param  retriever   The function that will retrieve the replacement
725     *      values for the given variable names.
726     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
727     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
728     *
729     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
730     *
731     *  @since 0.1.0
732     */
733    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
734    public static final String replaceVariable( final CharSequence text, final Function<? super String, Optional<String>> retriever )
735    {
736        requireNonNullArgument( retriever, "retriever" );
737
738        final Map<String,String> cache = new HashMap<>();
739
740        String retValue = null;
741        if( nonNull( text ) )
742        {
743            final var matcher = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text );
744            final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
745            while( matcher.find() )
746            {
747                final var variable = matcher.group( 0 );
748                final var replacement = cache.computeIfAbsent( variable, v -> escapeRegexReplacement( retriever.apply( matcher.group( 1 ) ).orElse( v ) ) );
749                matcher.appendReplacement( buffer, replacement );
750            }
751            matcher.appendTail( buffer );
752            retValue = buffer.toString();
753        }
754
755        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
756        return retValue;
757    }   //  replaceVariable()
758
759    /**
760     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code>
761     *  in the given String with values from the
762     *  {@linkplain System#getProperties() system properties},
763     *  the
764     *  {@linkplain System#getenv() system environment}
765     *  and the given maps. The method will try the maps in the given
766     *  sequence.<br>
767     *  <br>In addition, five more variables are recognised:
768     *  <dl>
769     *  <dt><b><code>tq.ip</code></b></dt>
770     *  <dd>The first IP address for the machine that executes this Java
771     *  virtual machine.</dd>
772     *
773     *  <dt><b><code>tq.mac</code></b></dt>
774     *  <dd>The MAC address of the first NIC in this machine.</dd>
775     *
776     *  <dt><b><code>tq.nodeId</code></b></dt>
777     *  <dd>The node id from the first NIC in this machine.</dd>
778     *
779     *  <dt><b><code>tq.now</code></b></dt>
780     *  <dd>The current date and time as returned by
781     *  {@link Instant#now}.</dd>
782     *
783     *  <dt><b><code>tq.pid</code></b></dt>
784     *  <dd>The process id of this Java virtual machine.</dd>
785     *  </dl>
786     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
787     *  replaced at all; no exception will be thrown.<br>
788     *  <br>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
789     *  will not be replaced.<br>
790     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.
791     *
792     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; can be {@code null}.
793     *  @param  additionalSources The maps with additional replacement values.
794     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
795     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
796     *
797     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
798     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
799     */
800    @SafeVarargs
801    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
802    public static final String replaceVariableFromSystemData( final CharSequence text, final Map<String,? extends Object>... additionalSources )
803    {
804        final var currentLen = requireNonNullArgument( additionalSources, "additionalSources" ).length;
805        final var newLen = currentLen + 3;
806        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
807        final Map<String,? extends Object> [] sources =  new Map [newLen];
808        if( currentLen > 0 )
809        {
810            arraycopy( additionalSources, 0, sources, 3, currentLen );
811        }
812
813        @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "rawtypes"} )
814        final Map<String,? extends Object> systemProperties = (Map) getProperties();
815
816        sources [0] = createAdditionalSource();
817        sources [1] = systemProperties;
818        sources [2] = getenv();
819
820        final var retValue = replaceVariable( text, sources );
821
822        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
823        return retValue;
824    }   //  replaceVariableFromSystemData()
825
826    /**
827     *  Tries to obtain a value for the given key from one of the given
828     *  sources that will be searched in the given sequence order.
829     *
830     *  @param  name    The name of the value.
831     *  @param  sources The maps with the values.
832     *  @return An instance of
833     *      {@link Optional}
834     *      that holds the value from one of the sources.
835     */
836    @SafeVarargs
837    private static final Optional<String> retrieveVariableValue( final String name, final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
838    {
839        assert nonNull( name ) : "name is null";
840        assert nonNull( sources ) : "sources is null";
841
842        Optional<String> retValue = Optional.empty();
843
844        //---* Search the sources *--------------------------------------------
845        Object value = null;
846        SearchLoop: for( final var map : sources )
847        {
848            value = map.get( name );
849            if( nonNull( value ) ) break SearchLoop;
850        }   //  SearchLoop:
851
852        if( nonNull( value ) )
853        {
854            //---* Escape the backslashes and dollar signs *-------------------
855            retValue = Optional.of( value.toString() );
856        }
857
858        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
859        return retValue;
860    }   //  retrieveVariableValue()
861}
862//  class Template
863
864/*
865 *  End of File
866 */
